text: emergency teams in pakistan are rushing
to rescue people who are trapped under
the rubble after an earthquake leveled
dozens of homes earlier at least 20
people have been confirmed dead in the
worst hit district in balochistan but
let's go over now to our correspondent
sahar baloch who's in the pakistani
capital islamabad zaha just tell us the
latest you're hearing
so right now the authorities are trying
to understand the extent of the damage
that has happened so it happened early
in the morning around 4 am and so far
the authorities are busy with the rescue
efforts and everything and they are
trying to understand like how far
away the damage has happened so i was in
contact with one of the
people from the provincial disaster
management authority and he told me that
so far three districts have been uh
severely damaged which is hanay pusheen
and zyarat so so far the authorities are
trying to understand like how far you
know the damage has happened so they are
also the rescue efforts are also you
know on their way uh the pakistan army
is also on the way and at the same time
you know they have rescued nine people
and taking them out of the place uh you
know through the helicopters and
everything so this is what we have so
far from
yeah and just tell us about the kind of
area where this has happened and how
difficult it is for rescuers to get to
these people
you know actually when it comes to
balochistan it is a huge huge land in
terms of like you know and then when it
comes to access so the access is not
that easy so when it comes to harnai and
pusheen and all these areas it is in the
northwest of uh you know balochistan so
over there the authorities uh you know
can only take help from the pakistan
army and can go there through
helicopters and everything uh also the
homes are not like you know really close
by they are far behind as well like you
know they are far away from each other
so going from one place to another also
takes time so uh going by land also
takes time as well like for instance if
you go from you know quetta to all of
these other cities it will take at least
four to five hours for the rescue
authorities to get to these places uh
and most of the people who have uh who
are basically seriously injured right
now are all those people who live in mud
houses uh so those places which were
like you know nicely built and
everything strongly built those houses
have not been damaged but when it comes
to the mud houses those are the ones
that have you know severely severely
been damaged and people are also
seriously injured so far 35 people are
seriously injured whereas 200 people are
you know they have gotten minor injuries
from this right and and do the
authorities fear that there's still be
maybe many more people trapped under

yes this is something you know that they
have shared that you know for the time
being if if i take you a bit back like
back in 2005 there was a big earthquake
in pakistan and at that point of time
most of the authorities and most of the
rescue efforts were being made in
islamabad a lot of people were focused
on islamabad and by the evening a lot of
people got to know that in you know
pakistan's administered kashmir area a
lot of people had you know died because

so this is not a similar situation but
in a way authorities are concerned that
there are still areas which are far
flung and they are trying to get to
